Patient Particulars: Name: Jackie; Sex: Female; Marital status: Married
Referral Information: Referred by: Physician; Reason for referral: Sleep disorder
Presenting Complaints (Symptoms):
1. Episodes of screaming and hitting in sleep
2. Having no memory of these episodes
History: Present history: Patient recently got married and started living with her husband where it was found that she wakes up every night and starts behaving indifferent. She screams, yells, hits her husband and also abuses him. Many times it has happened that her husband gets bruised due to the same. She had been living alone for a long time and so never realised that it has been happening to her. She remembered having her sheets pillows were always disorganised whenever she woke up but didn't pay attention to it that time. She consulted a physician recently where is a part of a study for behavioral sleep disorder. She was referred to seek counseling simultaneously to understand stressors or reasons behind.
Current Mental Status Examination: Behavior: Patient was cooperative and rapport could be established; Mood: Calm; Affect: Broad.
Issues discussed in Current Session: Patient's behavior after sleeping were discussed. She often wakes up at night and acts indifferently by screaming abuses and hitting her husband.
Action Plan: To include her husband in the therapy and also work in liaison with her physician.
